comment.text: This restaurant is the best when I say the food is emasculate it is . The service is on point from the time you enter to the time you exit. I took my daughter there for brunch and she is a picky eater and she really liked the food. Our waiter Deigo was AWESOME very informative and hands on throughout our visit. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great service and good food. And the ambiance was very modern and inviting
The food was fresh and delicious!  Our waitress, Mars (?) was pleasant and knowledgeable.  Our first time, and not our last!!
Awesome Food and Customer Service. Wait staff and Atmosphere was amazing. Will highly recommend this establishment to all my friends and colleagues.

If you haven't been here your missing out my only suggestion is call ahead cause the wait is real but they service is quick and there is not sacrifice in food quality. 

Their service and staff are top notch and extremely informed on favorite food and specials of the day and recommendations. 

Ambience is on another level between the outdoor DJ and food truck where you are able to grab drinks while you wait and the jumping music inside it is a very enjoyable place to enjoy some great food. 

Will continue to return here every time I visit Atlanta.

photos.caption: Chicken Biscuits with bacon and eggs smothered in gravy

comment.text:
Great service! Atlanta staple and the food was super yummy. My shrimp n grits were super tasty and my wife got the chicken n waffles!

Must try cinnamon roll and the hot chocolate. I saw a celebrity in here. So you know it's good!

photos.caption: Shrimp n Gulf Shrimp and GRITS WITH CHEESE

comment.text:
First of all my breakfast was absolutely delicious and my waiter was welcoming fun and friendly.  I enjoyed the music and the general informal fun ambience.  I had the chicken and waffles and loved it. The chicken was juicy and crispy and it had buttermilk and herbs. In the marinade . My waiter told me thyme is the special ingredient. The coffee was great. 
It is a popular location, because of being across from the Georgia aquarium. I would recommend if you don't like crowds to go as early as you can. I went at about 730 I think and it was not too crowded, but there was a line when I was leaving

My only complaint--I wished my waiter had asked if I wanted refills on the coffee during my meal. When I finally did ask for a refill when he came with the bill, he asked if I'd like the coffee to go. I felt a subtle pressure to leave at that point, but since he had not asked, if I wanted a refil during my meal, and I didn't really want to hike around town holding a coffee cup, I asked if it would be OK if I stayed and drank the coffee, and he said yes.
So that is the only caveat, that the place is so popular that you can't really linger over your breakfast without feeling a subtle pressure that you have overstayed. As long as you know that though, it's a fun place, friendly staff and the food is great.

photos.caption: Chicken and waffles and a cuppa coffee-- YUM!!!! Life is good!

comment.text:
5 words: P Biscuit with shrimp gravy. 
That's all you need to know, really, but if I were to elaborate on service, ambiance, etc., everything was top notch. The warm southern hospitality, the delicious flavors, the cool joint. Loved it all and it's well-worth a visit when in town.

So I'm not usually a breakfast girly -- BUT, ABC was amazing. We were told by one of my boyfriend's coworkers that this was a need to stop place during our trip to ATL. When we arrived we were told the wait was about an hour... we probably waited somewhere near 30 minutes or so which was a nice surprise especially since we were starving and fresh out of the airport. 

Our server was friendly and prompt. Their menu is available via QR code which I absolutely love. Who needs paper menus anymore, I mean really. 

They're known for the best fried chicken and waffles in ATL and man were they good. Both the boyfriend and I got modified versions. Mine was the Georgia Peach which is basically chicken and waffles but with peach cobbler thrown on top. It was divine. I would eat that 100 times over again.

The inside of the restaurant is clean and has a bit of a retro vibe inside. We enjoyed the retro vibes amidst the hustle and bustle of their uber busy restaurant.

One thing that I didn't particularly enjoy was that all of their cold drinks are bottled. So if you want a refill you'll have to just buy another (over priced) bottle. For reference, they sell the tiny bottles of Simply juices for $5 a piece. Any other breakfast spot has OJ and apple juice for $3-4 and it's refillable.

Let's start with the service for this review. We were greeted as we came in through the door and immediately directed to our table. Our server then gave us a great run down and offered some options and favorites without being asked. I always appreciate when a server clearly wants you to have a good experience. 

The building and settings said Atlanta to us. With great music playing and a well decorated atmosphere. 

It was the food though that set this place apart. You could take the great service and the well decorated and themed setting, but it wouldn't change the fact the food was absolutely top tier. 

You can't go wrong with the chicken and waffles and I don't know who thought up the P Buiscut, but give them a plaque or trophy up on the wall. 

Highly recommend making an excuse to visit!

Hands down, the best meal I had while visiting Atlanta. 

We were recommended the restaurant by a local a few days before we tried it. When figuring out where to go, I happened to see "join the wait-list" on yelp. We joined the 30 minute wait and took an Uber to the restaurant. When we got there, we were greeted with a mimosa truck and dj. Inside, the line was long and the music was loud. We were seated within 5 minutes. The hostess and waitress were very nice. 

When you arrive, you'll scan a QR code to look at the menu, though several dishes aren't on it. They recommend you look at their IG for inspiration. 

I ordered the cinnamon roll first, which was delicious. I took it to go, but it's definitely better fresh. 

Then, from recommendation, I ordered the p- biscuit with cheese and bacon. It was smothered in gravy, which was delicious but a bit overwhelming. My coworkers ordered the chicken and waffles with the peach cobbler topping. I had a bite and immediately regretted my decision. Though mine was the right kind of savory, I wished I had ordered both sweet and savory. It was all so delicious, though. 

It is a bit pricey, but it's a must-try.

photos.caption: P- biscuit with cheese and bacon

comment.text:
I decided to check out the Atlanta Breakfast Club at the recommendation of a friend. I walked in around 1pm on a Monday, and the restaurant was definitely winding down. If you don't mind eating breakfast food between 1pm-2pm, you will be able to avoid the wait! I had to wait a few minutes for a table to be cleared, but the restaurant was definitely starting to clear out when I left around 1:45pm. The ambiance is like a casual diner without any frills.

I decided to get the peach cobbler french toast ($17.95) since I did not want to chance the chicken being dry for the chicken and waffles. I also got a side order of eggs ($4) and unintentionally ordered water ($4). Overall, the french toast was solid, and I finished the whole thing. I would love to see more peaches and shortbread on the dish because they were so good and added moisture and flavor to the french toast. 

Ebonee was a great waitress! She explained the specials, did multiple check-backs, and did not make me feel rushed with the check. The only thing was that I wish she told me that the water would be "bottled" water. If tap water is not served/ good to drink, then I would have rather ordered juice if I had to pay for a beverage than bottled water. I enjoyed my experience here and would return for the chicken and waffles the next time I'm in Atlanta!

Came from a long flight and headed straight to ABC! It was our first time there and our waiter Johnny was the best! He gave tons of recommendations on what to eat at ABC and also where to visit in Atlanta. Southern hospitality at its finest! 

We ordered the cinnamon roll, shrimp & grits, and peach cobbler chicken and waffles. The cinnamon roll was nice and warm - they have a limited stock in the mornings. It was my boyfriend's first time trying shrimp and grits and he loved it! It was packed with flavor. I also enjoyed the peach cobbler chicken and waffles. The chicken was super juicy inside! I liked the cobbler topping as well, but it did start getting a little too sweet towards the end of the meal. Overall it was a great place to stop by for our first meal in Atlanta!

The food was amazing and the service was even better! Our waiter asked us what we were thinking and gave awesome recommendations. 

We got the southern benedict with chicken sausage gravy instead, the chicken and waffles with chicken sausage gravy, and the breakfast sandwich. 

Let me tell you...that chicken sausage gravy is AMAZING! Definitely come here for breakfast if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Southern Benedict, Chicken Sausage Gravy, Crispy Fried Chicken and Waffles, Breakfast Sandwich

comment.text:
Tel for the win again! Checked for Brunch places near us in downtown, decided on this place and hurried on our way. Especially impressed with the newly discovered waitlist feature on Yelp. We had to wait but always knew our place in line. Terrific service and delicious food made up for the noise level.
Whatever you order I bet it's delicious!

AMAZING food! Great service and very friendly staff. The place was bumping on a Saturday morning. We waited a bit for a table for 8 (as expected). This special southern sandwich was out of this world. There was no way I could eat the whole thing. This menu item could be shared by 2.

Food is great! Very tasteful I had the Southern Benedict ! Delicious, good portion love the biscuit! Chicken was juicy. Nice place, modern yet retro ! Server knew his product well as he made recommendations and was friendly (I'll forgive him for forgetting my brother's request for a side biscuit).  Parking is not the best, very few stalls to park on.

Bre had the Best Customer Service! Title: "A Breakfast Experience Not To Be Missed in Atlanta!"

From the moment I stepped into the Atlanta Breakfast Club, I knew I was in for a treat. The vibrant atmosphere, combined with the tantalizing aroma of breakfast delights, set the stage for an exceptional dining experience.

The menu, a delightful array of classic and innovative breakfast dishes, left me spoilt for choice. I opted for their famous Peach Cobbler French Toast, and it was nothing short of a culinary masterpiece. The toast was perfectly crisp, topped with just the right amount of sweetness from the peach cobbler, creating a symphony of flavors in every bite.

What truly sets the Atlanta Breakfast Club apart, however, is their impeccable service. The staff was attentive, friendly, and genuinely seemed to care about making our dining experience memorable. They were quick to offer recommendations and ensured our coffee cups were never empty.

The ambiance of the restaurant is also worth mentioning. It's a perfect blend of cozy and chic, making it an ideal spot for both casual breakfasts and special occasions.

In conclusion, the Atlanta Breakfast Club is a gem in the heart of the city. Whether you're a local or just passing through, this place is a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in a breakfast experience that's truly exceptional. Five stars all the way!

We chose this place in a while being picked up from the airport. Everyone who decides to board and early flight either buys food in the airport or is starving after arriving at their final destination... I chose the latter. 
The place is standard dinner style and quaint but lively and clean. 
We arrived to during which could easily be described as high peak time... Sunday, early afternoon, Super Bowl weekend. The restaurant was packed but it didn't take long for the hostess to squeeze us in to a table. The waitress was friendly and knowledgeable. She told us "anything with gravy or peaches is amazing!" We decided on the Georgia Peach chicken and waffles which was peach cobbler style waffle sandwich and two orders of the breakfast sandwich. I ordered a side of the turkey based chicken gravy to accompany my breakfast sandwich. 
Listen... the food was absolutely amazing! I mean.... EVERYTHING!!! I could have licked the plate. 
If you have the chance to stop in... do it!

photos.caption: Breakfast sandwich with waffle, chicken fried chicken,  two eggs, Turkey Bacon, Cheddar Cheese,

comment.text:
I randomly had this spot bookmarked - random because I don't live in Atlanta and don't know how I heard about it. I came for a work event and decided to come for breakfast on my last day. Luckily it was a quick walk from where I was staying.

I came at the perfect time, because it was PACKED as I was leaving. Anyways their menu is delicious, it was very hard to choose what I wanted and I wanted to try a lot of things. This was heavvyyy, if I didn't have coffee I would've taken a nap after my meal  solid place, I'll definitely come back if I'm in the area, it's definitely a hotspot!

First off, DJ was lit. We came on a Saturday and the wait was quite long actually, ended up being about 40 minutes. However, they did have a DJ that was playing hip-hop in R&B music outside, which did half the time pass. I came here with a party of seven girls, we are all visiting.

First off, I must say that the chicken and waffles were bomb. The peach cobbler was amazing as well, though I do not think that I can eat the whole thing by myself given the sweetness. I think the smartest thing to do is to get a savory dish, and then split the peach cobbler between the table.

Service was 10/10. 

Beware, they do ask if you would like to add on things to your meal, which ends up increasing the price of the meal by a great amount.

Pro tip : bring your own water bottle, because the water is not free. I repeat the WATER IS NOT FREE!!

photos.caption: Chicken and waffle with peach and crumble

comment.text: Talk about aesthetically pleasing, large portions of delicious food! We came here for brunch while we were in Atlanta because it was so well known. We came close to when they opened to try to beat the line and were able to get a table quickly. It was still absolutely packed in the restaurant. Our waitress was great and gave us the lay of the menu, including all the secret menu items! The French toast was so delicious and probably tasted the best but I always need something salty with my sweet too. Both of our salty dishes were from the secret menu and both were delicious, just very rich! We weren't even close to being able to finish our dishes so be prepared for leftovers.

Personal Rating: [2.5/5], Yelp Rating: [4/5]

Food was fine. I extremely dislike how they charge for water. Service was ok.

Crispy Fried Chicken and Waffle [3/5] - chicken was a bit dry
Peach Cobbler French Toast [5/5]
Salmon Croquettes [4/5]

Okay let's just start off by saying if you want to find parking it's going to be a little tough in this neighborhood because the aquarium is right in front of this restaurant. I would suggest you park at the aquarium for 20 bucks eat at this restaurant and then walk it off at the aquarium! Because these plates are full of yumminess! At one point I even said, "heart attack on a plate" I have never seen so much gravy and crispy bacon and eggs the way I like it over easy with yummy biscuits. Now mind you I am not a breast gal. I like dark meat all day long. But the way this server Janise described this meal I had to get it. It was a little loud to hear what it was called so I had to focus on reading her lips to actually know what was in it. Service was quick which is usually not a good sign but this food came and filled up the plate with all of the southern hospitality it had to offer. My server said they marinate the chicken for 24 hours. I am now an official breast meat eater, but only at this place . They have this truck outside that's blasting really good tunes that serve the drinks. I got my BFF and I two passion fruit mimosas after we ordered. They put them in coffee cups so you can take them into the restaurant. The price $14 each. Cha ching it was a nice light buzz while we ate and talked. Knowing that I wasn't going to drive afterwards that's why I suggested going to the aquarium or some other downtown event. I guess this is the happening place to go. I agree.

photos.caption: Our waitress with the mostest and fastest service Janice.
It was so good to see her before we went in.
The truck that sells the drinks right outside.
Is that a full play or what? Just so you know I only ate one and took the other one home for dinner.
My BFF had chicken and waffles with peaches on top.
The place was packed at 11:30 a.m. on a Saturday. A little loud for my taste but nice decor.
My chicken breasts over easy egg with crispy bacon cheddar cheese and gravy.

comment.text: The place is jumping with flavor! Super busy but they make the time! We joined the waitlist and was seated with 20 mins. Inside is a home style cafe feel with the absolute best southern hospitality! My only issue was food took forever ! That seems to be an Atlanta trend they just take their time no matter what! Breakfast tacos adding chicken was a match made in heaven!

When you go to heaven and you go where the Georgia section is
This is the place
This is Georgia!!!
The food is outstanding, the staff is amazing and they are all so beautiful! The music is great and the everything here is just wonderful 

The food...omg coming from New Orleans..This food is AMAZING

photos.caption: Waffles and chicken and peach cobbler  I'm crying.
Chicken biscuit with everything  Still crying

comment.text: Man look a here! I showed up today for the first time today. And I tell you, everything was great!! The customer service, taste of the food, and the total vibe there was fantastic! I can't wait to take my family there! And my people were working excellence in there. Nothing like my brothers and sisters being right!!!
Such a vibe. Great food, great service - go on an off day like Tuesday midday just to avoid a wild crowd cuz this place gets lit

Let me start out with Dijon, the server, was my favorite part of this restaurant. He was really fun and helpful. The portions here were generous. One pancake took up the plate. My friend said it was crispy on the outside, which is what she liked. Oh, the cinnamon roll is divine. We ordered two and couldn't get enough of them. Baby, I'd have taken some home with me. Their hot sauce is mouth-watering. I wanted to snag a bottle of it. 
The music was another favorite part. They made me pull out Shazam so I could capture the playlist. It wasn't so loud that we had to raise our voices but it definitely played a part in our conversations. It felt like a place you could hang with your cousins and be happy. Oh but no one was happy about getting boxed water. We would have preferred a quick conversation to let us know.

Luckily, my friend and I waitlisted via Yelp to dine here on a Sunday at 11 a.m. Staff was superb! The hostess seated us promptly, although the place was packed, and our waitress greeted us within minutes of getting seated and went over some of the most popular items on their menu. I ordered the Southern Breakfast with seasonal vegetables, potatoes, and wheat toast, while my friend got the Breakfast Bowl. We both thought our orders were pretty average; most of the items lacked salt - or any flavors. It was a healthy meal, but nothing absolutely blew us away.

Atlanta breakfast strikes again! This is A+ quality food. I tasted the pancakes, eggs, grits,  potatoes and biscuits. I ordered to go because the line to wait on a Sunday morning was so long (as expected). 

The vibe here is simple but cute. I don't know much about the service and there is a piece of me that hope it is perfect because that is the only reason for four stars. I cannot say enough good things about how good breakfast was here.

You must come here if you're in the downtown Atlanta vicinity. The food was spectacular, and the hospitality was great. Be sure to check the wait list before you go and put your name on it. Saturday morning around 9:30 there was over an hour wait. It's a small little spot with excellent food and fast service.

We went with the recommendations of our server, and we were not disappointed. The shrimp gravy and biscuits should be on every menu, so delicious, and I think even better than sausage gravy. The chicken and waffles were elevated with peach cobbler topping and fresh fruit. We also added bacon because everything is better with bacon.

It is a bit pricey for breakfast, and they will charge you for all the extras, like bacon and fruit. An orange juice will run you almost $6. But it was definitely worth it. For true Southern comfort food and warm hospitality, this is definitely a spot to check out.

These days eating out is expensive, and it's hard to justify expensive breakfast. But it's hard to not justify Atlanta Breakfast Club. The chicken on the waffle was breaded delicately and the meat was juicy and not the least tough. The waffles and eggs over easy were cooked perfectly as was the biscuit. We had a great meal and the waiter was extremely pleasant and hd no trouble checking in with us, topping off coffees while juggling multiple tables. A class act and worth a trip.

We came here on a Tuesday, we were sat immediately, with a super friendly waitress. I had the peach French toast that were delicious. They are very very sweet though so heads up if that's not your thing. 
Parking is hectic, it's street parking and after going around the block several times we gave up and parked at the aquarium across the street.

We were in town to see Aladdin at the fox theatre last night and this morning we wanted to grab brunch before we headed home to Aiken, SC. I checked yelp & ABC's menu resonated with us.

We headed there this morning and were instantly greeted with a friendly host and seated promptly.

You are given instructions to check the menu on the QR code. This was an easy process and we quickly decided what we wanted to eat. 

I chose the peach cobbler French toast. 10/10  it was absolutely delicious. Very generous portions. I will be dreaming of this dish.

My husband chose the southern Benedict. 10/10  when asked if he has any comments about his choice, he said pure perfection.

They do only offer bottled drinks for water and fountain drinks from my understanding. Their bottled water comes in sustainable packaging but is rather expensive at $4/bottle. I ordered hot tea and was given multiple tea options.

Our waitress was so sweet, prompt & caring.

I would 100% recommend ABC!

It's nestled between the lounge and the Springhill. 

It is lively, loud and animated in here. 

Started off with the oatmeal and the yogurt and freshly baked granola and added fruit, the breakfast bowl with chicken sausage with scrambled eggs and a biscuit, side of chicken sausage, side of Turkey bacon, black coffee and Simply Orange juice. $61.38.

My husband wanted an omelet, but it starts at $11 for just the 4 eggs, everything is an add-on, easy to rack up a $25+ omelet.

They do have fresh baked cinnamon roll, but it's topped with icing. I rather prefer cream cheese frosting if I eat a cinnamon roll at all. 
All drinks come in bottles except for tea and black coffee, no latte, mocha or anything fancy as far as coffee goes. 

Their biscuits are good, light, flaky and not dry at all, even better with some honey. 

The breakfast bowl was okay, the grits were good. Just enough to be filling. 

Our server disappeared for a while, another server put in our order for oatmeal.

The yogurt and granola wasn't too bad, the granola looked pulverized more than I was expecting. The fruit was on the bottom. I was expecting berries, but melon, cantaloupe and pineapple at all.

The chicken sausage and the Turkey bacon were both nicely grilled and tasted good. 

The oatmeal looks good, rather skimpy on the berries though, more is extra, of course. It tastes some comforting. It's well balanced with the sweet mcinnamon and sugar.
Service was superb, food was fantastic. Went there back to back days because it was that good. Loved the environment and all the host had great energy.

Coming to Georgia, I was excited to try the well recommended chicken and waffles, and peach cobbler from the Atlanta Breakfast Club. Walking in at around 12pm on a weekday, there was a table available for 3, so there was no wait. We ordered the Georgia Peach (which is a chicken and waffles sandwich, with peach cobbler on top), Seafood Gumbo, and Sweet Tea. The chicken and the gumbo tasted fine, but the sweet tea and peach cobbler on top was crazy sweet! Not sure if this is normal, but it was an experience trying their sweet tea because it tasted like syrup. Good thing I bought my own water to cleanse my palate because you would have had to pay for bottled water. They do not service tap water. 
Additionally, we really did not get much service. The waiter came to take our order, brought us food, and then the bill. There was no checking in as to how we were doing throughout the meal, and he didn't even give us a spoon for the gumbo. He did not give me space when paying the bill and tipping either. My friend saw him looking at the machine as I was putting in a custom tip. I've never had this happen before as servers usually walk away or turn away when customers pay...  We kind of just wanted to leave as soon as we finished eating.

Let me first start off by saying I rolled out of the restaurant stuffed!!
 My waiter was so nice I believe his name was Kenny, so helpful.I was not sure what to order so he helped me and we came with the chef special. You can choose either grits or potatoes; I chose grits and I'm greedy so I wanted the peach cobbler french toast as well. Make sure you order half an order because it is so much food. The peach cobbler french toast was good but not amazing nothing stuck out, no overwhelming flavor of nutmeg or anything like that. The fried lobster was fried perfectly it was still soft and buttery. The shrimp gravy had a really smooth taste to it with big shrimp.  Overall everything was really really good.

photos.caption: Fried lobster ,cheese grits and shrimp gravy

comment.text:
Amazing food. Favorite brunch spot.
The wait can be a bit too much though. My fav French toast in town.

Went around 11 am on a weekday and this place was packed. Make sure to add your party on the Yelp waitlist in advance if you want to reduce your wait. The patio had some heat lamps and there were a few benches available. Once we were seated, service was quick and informative. The food arrived very shortly after we ordered which was impressive. The peach cobbler French toast had a delicious sauce and I enjoyed the shortbread crumbles. However, the dish was quite sweet and I could barely finish the second half of the dish as the sweetness was so overpowering. I wish there was a savory element to balance it out. While the dishes look great, I think the food quality is not high enough to justify the expensive price point.

Loved this place! We were visiting from out of town and got right in when they opened! Food was fantastic! I could not finish my meal,the portions were great!! Would love to go back the next time I'm in the area. The service was awesome and it was a simple decor.

If I could give this place 6 stars I would! Our waiter, PAUL, hooked us up with great recommendations, was attentive, and friendly! We got called to our table quickly, even with a full house. The whole staff was kind and on it!! Now the food: I wanted to cry because it was so tasty! I ordered the chicken and waffles: the waffles were fluffy with the perfect amount of body, bearly touched the syrup and  I'm a syrup fan. THE CHICKEN. The chicken was tender, well seasoned and juicy! Also ordered a side of grits, which were delicious. I took bites of the other orders on the table (biscuit with shrimp gravy+eggs Benedict): another 10/10 for those dishes. I can't recommend this place enough. Go!!

So this place has such good potential. I've been hearing about it for years and decided let me try it out. The service of the ambience were very well done.

The problem I had was the excessive price. Most things were almost $20 and the water was five dollars. I have only had to pay for water outside of the US and the amount of food that receives was not proportional to the price stated. I expected so much more in quantity, but the quality was amazing. It more felt like fine dining portions, then a breakfast diner portion, if that makes sense. The service was amazing as I said before and the staff is very quick and attentive.

I can see how parking can be rough, but they have extra limited parking in the back.

Service was exceptionally fast and friendly.  The food came out hot and was quick.  The food itself was very good - probably worthy of a 4 rating.  The service was a 5+, so we round up to a five.  There was a lot of flexibility with the ordering to allow for customization - e.g., swap potatoes for grits, etc.  The one issue was the potatoes, though tasty, were overly salty and I love salt!

photos.caption: Scrambled eggs with turkey bacon, potatoes and wheat toast
Breakfast bowl with potatoes and chicken sausage

comment.text: Good food and good service. Our waitress was very intensive and helpful with the menu. She even gave us a list of things to do while we were here.

IF YOU COME HERE GET THE PEACH COBBLER FRENCH TOAST! This was the very first southern breakfast joint I tried out when I first moved to Atlanta and it did not disappoint. I loved the peach compote they use and this item is a treat for sure. ABC is conveniently located right near the aquarium and Coca Cola factory touristy area though so 10000% make sure to make a reservation or plan ahead before coming because the lines are brutal otherwise. Also fair warning that they charge you $8 for water with your meal, so if you want something to drink with your meal you might as well try out the sweet tea/orange juice instead.

My partner and I were lucky to come in without a wait around the holidays when everyone must have left the city, but the restaurant was still buzzing and boisterous inside with a mix of travelers and locals. We were heading to the airport right after and aimed to not have leftovers, which seems difficult with how many of the neighboring tables left with containers! Just a heads up that they only serve bottled water with a charge here and not tap water, which our server clarified and we were able to turn down without issue. 

Our server was friendly and offered options to customize our orders, but we were already set to order their most popular items. My partner got the chicken and waffles with really well battered and seasoned chicken that he almost didn't want to share with me (I still got a bit to confirm how good it was!). I got a half order of the peach cobbler french toast, which was just delicious with crunchy cobbler crumbles and a good balance of peaches and syrup that made it not too sweet. The half order was already a pretty hefty portion, and of course my partner had to help me finish it too - very glad they have the option of half orders. We also got a side of fried green tomatoes for the heck of it. Probably the least value out of what we ordered, but just wanted to try the dish while we were visiting. The other two dishes absolutely deserved their reputation, and best of all, we were able to clean it all up with no leftovers!

photos.caption: Half order of peach cobbler french toast

comment.text: This is our first time trying this establishment and we were blown away by the phenomenal service, atmosphere, and food. Our server Spencer was amazing and so attentive, he explained the menu and took the time to answer any questions. I ended up ordering the peach cobbler French toast with a side of bacon and my wife ordered the chicken and waffles. Everything came out nice & hot and was flavorful. I would definitely recommend to anyone to try them.

This was our first time visiting Atlanta Breakfast Club. We had a large group but got on yelp waitlist and were stated quickly! The service was excellent! The house made sweet tea was perfect. We had Shrimp and Grits and the Peach Cobbler French Toast. The portions were very large and soooo delicious.

Southern charm at its best, and A MUST VISITThe Staff, Chef's, atmosphere, our Server (Jessica), and stellar service was epic (AMAZING) Mouth watering breakfast waiting patiently just for you; with delicious butter tasting grits, biscuits & more. Great coffee, served with cream & honey (my request), was a definite winner. 

Ok, I must confess this realism. The air quality, the hospitality and their eggs  in ATL are incredibly much better than what we breathe, with effortlessly extended smiles (except NYer's) and naturally fluffy eggs here in the North While visiting my daughter in ATL  (who needed a mommy hug), of course I obliged; and was eager to find a restaurant to place my YELP's Squad gracious stamp of approval; hands down. Thank you! Oh, it does close early (2:45p /EST)

photos.caption: Crispy Fried Chicken with Biscuits and Gravy ( I plead the 5th)
Peach  Cobbler French Toast (There are no words)
